channel.title: Java Bytecode manipulation library
channel.description: does anybody know of a Java Bytecode manipulation library for VB6 or VB.net?

item.title: Java Bytecode manipulation library
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:9, topic:170084”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=229923.msg2058748#msg2058748 date=1203242737]

write your own. if you’re experienced enough, you could just port BCEL or someother project to a visual basic library.
[/quote]Lol, porting Java to VB.

I fucking lol’d.

pwnd_, it’s possible, even though 99% of people who don’t talk shit out of their ass discourage it. but if he really needs this done, it’s one of the possible ways.[/quote]
Ofcouse it’s possible, you just have to write some wrappers for unsupported functions. But there’s no reason to create a library.
Easier solution would be, get VS 2005. Install J#, import all bcel classes. Fix the few errors and compile to dll.
Then add the dll to your vb.net project…
It’s even possible to run a deob in J#, the only thing you need to do is create wrappers for the Image related classes. (Because J# is build on java 1.1.4)

Read full topic

the reason 99% of the bytecode manipulation libraris are written in java is because it is easier. VB is shit for anything that doesnt revolve around a gui, so i have nfi why you would want to use it
